pr_title: TSK-1443: Order TaskQueries by Workbasket Name

timeline.bodyText: These are the workbasket names, not the ids, right?
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe
gitgoodjhe

timeline.bodyText: I'm missing a separate "joinWithWorkbaskets" property here like for the attachments and classifications.
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -37,6 +40,9 @@
           + "<if test=\"joinWithAttachmentClassifications\">"
           + "LEFT JOIN CLASSIFICATION AS ac ON a.CLASSIFICATION_ID = ac.ID "
           + "</if>"
+          + "<if test=\"addWorkbasketNameForOrdering\">"

timeline.bodyText:
should we name this "addWorkbasketNameToSelectClauseForOrdering" to be consistent with the rest?
Aren't we missing a "joinWithWorkbaskets" property? (Which should probably also be handled in the setupJoinAndOrderParameters() method)
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe

replies.bodyText:
The way I see it, a different handling of "joinWithWorkbasket" and "addWorkbasketNameToSelectClauseForOrdering" is not necessary. When joining the workbaskets in the queries we always want to also select the workbasket name.
The  reason is that we don't implement the option to search for a certain workbasket name in which case we would join but not select. We only want to be able to order the results by the workbasket names (join + select).
replies.author: tge20

replies.bodyText: "addWorkbasketNameToSelectClauseForOrdering" would be consistent, in my view "addWorkbasketNameForOrdering" is easier and could emphasize the difference to attachments and classifications...
replies.author: tge20

timeline.author: gitgoodjhe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -848,6 +848,15 @@ TaskQuery customAttributeLike(TaskCustomField customField, String... searchArgum
    */
   TaskQuery orderByWorkbasketId(SortDirection sortDirection);
 
+  /**
+   * This method sorts the query result according to the workbasket-Name of the tasks.

timeline.bodyText: should we name this "addWorkbasketNameToSelectClauseForOdering", to be consistent with the if tests for ClassificationName and AttachmentClassificationName? (See TaskQueryImpl comment)
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe

timeline.bodyText:
Our naming pattern for tests is:
should_ExpectedBehavior_When_StateUnderTest
Example: "should_AddErrorsForInvalidTaskIds_When_BulkForceCompletingTasks()"
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe

timeline.bodyText: Please don't use admin as the user
timeline.author: gitgoodjhe

replies.bodyText: @gitgoodjhe why not? Was done in that file anyway
replies.author: mustaphazorgati

replies.bodyText: @mustaphazorgati admin skips several security checks. That's not important here, but as a general rule we usually don't use admin in tests unless it is really needed to test admin features
replies.author: gitgoodjhe

timeline.author: mustaphazorgati

timeline.message: TSK-1443: Implemented an option to order the result of the TaskQuery by the Workbasket-Name.
